fields.title: Allow filtering the repositories page
fields.body: Now that stateful repository links have been removed by #67 and #73, it is time to inject JSON repository models into the page, render the table client-side using AngularJS, and allow real-time filtering.  The design will be very similar to the *FilterableRepositoryList*.

comment.text: James, would you have any objections to me having a go at this? I'm not quite sure when at the moment as I'm quite busy but hopefully would be able to squeeze it in.

Sorry for the double-post, not sure what happened.

Sure.  This is easier with the 1.6 release since management links have been moved internal to the repository.

Take a look at *FilterableRepositoryList*.  My plan was to follow that design: Wicket+FreeMarker+Angular.

The basic idea is to inject a JSON array of the minimum viable repo information into the Wicket+FreeMarker generated page and then render the repo list client-side with Angular.  Once you have that working, adding an Angular filter is easy.  There are also nice Angular grids that support grouping rows and collapse/expand.
Ok cheers, I'll start working on this issue.
